author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

On Ubuntu 16.04 desktop VM
Following the steps for installing PowerShell:
$ sudo apt-get install libunwind8 libicu55
$ sudo dpkg -i powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb
## Expected behavior

To install without errors.
## Actual behavior

![poshlinuxerr_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/17651383/10306694-6234-11e6-8256-0978d5fffa8c.jpg)
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
Did you follow this step from the [Ubuntu 16.04 Installation Instructions](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/installation/linux.md#ubuntu-1604)

> Using Ubuntu 16.04, download the Debian package powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb from the releases page onto the Ubuntu machine.

Once you have downloaded the file, make sure this command is run in the same folder as the file.

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: @TravisEz13 I end up getting further but get an error with System.Data.SqlClient.dll as shown below

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
Let's verify you downloaded it without error

```
 $ /usr/bin/md5sum ./powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb 
```

You should expect to see the following:

`fb02cf0d56ee5b1f27e5fbd86a8928cf  ./powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb`

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
Seems for me the issue was that the download got bashed somewhere between my host machine and the Ubuntu Vm

Could we perhaps get MD5 hashes added to the table with download links?

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hi Travis!  I'm getting no md5 results. (See image)
![poshlinuxerr_02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/17652111/84574232-6242-11e6-8c71-e35ffaf7cfc1.jpg)

Hum! Am I doing something wrong?
Max

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body: I forgot to mention that I use the instructions for Ubuntu 16.04. By the way, this VM has SQL Server installed. I hope is not impacting PowerShell installation. :)

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
I found that the file was in the downloads folder so try

```
cd \Downloads
/usr/bin/md5sum ./powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb
```

if that works for you then you should be able to do 

```
sudo dpkg -i powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb
```

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
OK!  So, after looking around, the bottom line is that I'm not downloading the file. Even though I'm following the instructions for Ubuntu 16.04, my "Downloads" folder is empty. I can't use the md5sum to verify it.

![poshlinuxerr_03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/17652307/f4836f00-6246-11e6-8e07-005eaf9ed32b.jpg)

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body:
@MaximoTrinidad How do you follow the instructions, if you are not downloading the file?
Doc clearly states "Using Ubuntu 16.04, download the Debian package  powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb  from the releases page onto the Ubuntu machine."

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Damn Alexandair!  I truly skipped that part. went straight to the installation instruction. Thanks for redirecting my brain.  Greatly Appreciated!  
Duh!

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
OK! 

Now I did the download and use the md5sum to verify the checksum. But, I can't still install PowerShell.
Hey Alexandar! What I'm missing now?

![poshlinuxerr_04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/17652547/ea4cd44e-624c-11e6-87e8-61d5a12996e7.jpg)

comments.author: kiazhi
comments.body:
Hi @MaximoTrinidad,

I wonder if the Checksum of that file is correct. I'm getting a different value of the MD5 checksum. Is the Checksum of that file posted some where that we can verify?

![powershell_6 0_alpha 8-1_ubuntu 16 04-x64_md5_checksum](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13409063/17652725/539c5088-62d8-11e6-9799-efa04cd458e9.jpg)

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hi Kiazhi!  
You are correct. Your MD5 checksum doesn't match mine. 
![poshlinuxerr_05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/17652938/17fa16d0-6258-11e6-949b-32245293428a.jpg)

I don't know what to do here!

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body: I'm going to try building a CentOS Linux (minimal) version and try another build tomorrow. Just to get something going. I won't delete my current Ubuntu VM until I clear this issue.

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
@MaximoTrinidad it looks like you have the right file as the MD5 has is right BUT you need to cd in to the downloads directory before you can run the dpkg command

(see my earlier response for the commands)

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: @kiazhi - The MD5 sum given by @TravisEz13 was correct - try re-downloading the deb package and then re-checking the MD5 hash

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
OK! I had to change directory to Downloads, did the MD5Sum, and that folder did the "sudo dpkg ..". Its loading now. I'm paying the price for not playing with Linux but I love challenges.

![poshlinux](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/17663881/f257d938-62bd-11e6-96da-80c5c18f76af.jpg)

Thanks everyone for helping me!

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Sounds like you're set so I'm closing the issue.

title: Error: cannot access archive: no such file "powershell_6.0.0-alpha.8-1_amd64-ubuntu.16.04-x64.deb"
